subject: Public Speaking
title: Malala at the United Nations
description: A fast breakdown of Malala at the United Nations for builders.

hook.text: Nine months after being shot in the head by the Taliban, a 16-year-old addressed the United Nations.

buildup.text: Malala Yousafzai spoke about the right to education, especially for girls in regions where it's denied.

discovery.text: She said: One child, one teacher, one book, one pen can change the world. Simplicity carried immense weight.

twist.text: The Taliban thought shooting her would silence the cause. Instead it gave it a face and a global platform.

climax.text: Malala showed that moral authority doesn't come from age or title. It comes from surviving what you speak about.

punchline.text: They shot her to silence her. She got louder.

quiz.question: How old was Malala when she addressed the United Nations?
